Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: A year younger than I was for my first.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: When can I have a stag?

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: a stag?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Oh come on!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Why would they join up against the Irish?

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Because someone has to stand up to them.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You?

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Me, Marke, all the tribes. We cant resist alone.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I could.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Oh my little warrior. We have to be careful.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Come home without something for your Lady there will be hell to pay.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Can I?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: The Angles have arrives my Lord, as well as the Carrods, our fellow Jutes and the Saxons.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Good. With Marke, all will be here.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Yeah. It is a great day.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Let us hope so.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Thanks.  [The boy starts to make a bracelet out of the herbs. Going up to Lady Marke he hands her the finished wreath]

Speaker: lady marke
Dialogue: We heard the news...

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Mother, I made this for you

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Friends, look at us.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: The tribes of Britain. Divided. Weak. Just as the Irish like us. But if we were one land united, we would out number them two to one. We could defeat them once and for all. That is why we are here today, to sign this treaty of unification.

Speaker: lord
Dialogue: But who would be King?

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: The strongest among us: Lord Marke.

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Look if you are happy sending all of your gold to Ireland, living as slaves then by all means do nothing.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: If we were happy doing that then we would never have risked coming here.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Friends. My wife is with child, my heart tells me it is a boy. I want him to grow old in a land where all of us, all the tribes: Pict, Celt, Angle, Jute, Saxon are at peace. This island has not known unity since the Romans left. That is why I sign this treaty.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: And why should we follow you?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Perhaps, Wictred, because your last attempt to form an alliance without the knowledge of half the Barons in this room has failed.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: My Lord! The Irish are here!

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Take all your men. Guard the women!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: But you...

Speaker: aragon
Dialogue: Go!!!

Speaker: lady marke
Dialogue: Tristan! Hurry! Come this way.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: How did they know?

Speaker: lady marke
Dialogue: Tristan!  [Aragon manages to hold his son back and puts him in a hold under the floorboards. Aragon is then killed by Morholt. There is more destruction and fire breaks out. Tristan reaches up to touch the floorboards above and finds his fathers seeping blood on his hands. Tristan comes out of the hole and surveys the destruction. His father and Lady Marke are dead. Suddenly he is attacked by an Irishman but Marke jumps in to save him, losing his hand in the process]

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Shes with the Gods now Isolde, youll see her again someday.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Will I?

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: Morholt returns.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: What news of the treaty?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Good Morholt, good

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Your mother loved you so much Isolde

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Why did she die Bragnae? Why?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: It was an ill fever that took her. Fever.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: No. It was her heart.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Your husband?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Oh sister I am so sorry.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: A whole generation of men.

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: Whos this?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan. Son of Aragon. Were his family now.

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: I have a son about your age. Melot! Melot!  Melot, this is Tristan.

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: What shall we do, my Lord?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Rebuild.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Dont hold back  [Marke loses the fight easily. A boy starts yelling to the other boys]

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Tristan wont fight me! Look hes scared!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Still won't fight?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Tristan has the heart of a lion.He just needs some time.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Why did you take off your helmet? You going to cry? My father died too, but you dont see me crying!

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: Melot!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Run! Find another trapdoor to hide under. Coward!

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: sammy
Dialogue: Tristan! Tristan! Weve found something! Come on, this way.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: You will love it.

Speaker: simon
Dialogue: I found a trapdoor!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: You found a trapdoor? Alright Simon, will you tell us all how you found it?! Look at that!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Where does this lead?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Youll see. I like that vase, I think I'll have that. I always knew the Castle was built on Roman foundations but we didnt think anything was left!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Must be a burial crypt or something.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Here we are: the bottom of the keep.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Who else knows about this?

Speaker: sammy
Dialogue: Nobody.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: The savages have rebuilt the castle at Cornwall, only now its made of stone.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Of Cornwalls next tribute I want slaves. Young ones. Their future. If Marke resists have Morholt crush him.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: My King.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Morholt.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: I have led your armies to victory far and near. Iv made you rich and powerful.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Yes you have. You have been most loyal.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: When I return from Cornwall, I was hoping...

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: What would please you?

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: A wife.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Its dark in an hour.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: What do you think is really out there?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Britannia. The old Roman lands. Full of evil and grief.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I want to see it. Do you know what the future looks like Bragnae?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: I see the life you were meant for. Your father will speak with you.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Am I just a chattel to be traded at your pleasure? Do I have no say in my own life?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: You have a duty to your King.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: You are my father.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Then obey me, daughter.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: Your father has given you the news?

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: And you welcome it?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I accept it.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: You know, we are more alike than you might guess.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: How so?

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: I too dabble in elixirs.  Poison from the livers of a puffer fish. Just a taste paralyses all the senses. So if the blade doesnt kill...

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Rendered safe by thistle and bark.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: And you know the antidote for this?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Yohimbine.

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: Makes a hard man even harder.  The only cure... wild abandon. Till out wedding day. Im to Cornwall, to deal with rabbles.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Release them.  [The Irish men spread out and start collecting Cornish men and women as hostages]

Speaker: cornish man
Dialogue: Leave her!

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Take him there. Get a rope. Any man foolish enough to interfere in any way shall suffer the same fate.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: No! No! Please No!

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: If there are any more attacks we shall put our guests to death and raise this entire land. Take the horses.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: When would you strike?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: At once. Throw everything we have at them.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: They are hoping you'll do that. On horse they outnumber us two to one. You would lead the men straight to their deaths.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: So we do nothing?!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Donnchadh would like that even more. Me to lose face in front of the other tribes. No, we must act. We must be decisive but we cannot act alone.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: So. Have the good men of York come to fight with us? Hm? The Saxons of Wessex?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: My men dont want to follow a Pict into battle. Let alone one leading a pack of Angles and Celts.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Then why are you here?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: I thought Tristan should let me command his men.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I make it my habit to follow no one.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Except Marke.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Marke delivered me from that place when I was a boy. You ran. So you can understand that when I think of Kings I think of him. When I think of cowards...

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: They are one day from their boats on the old Roman road. Now who will ride out with Tristan to fight them?

Speaker: lord
Dialogue: What is your plan, Tristan?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: We will need our two fastest runners.

Speaker: irish man
Dialogue: Go around!  [They continue to pursue the runners on foot. Suddenly Tristan and his men spring up from hidden holes under the loam and shoot the Irish with their bows. The Irish are attacked from all sides and defeated. Back at the main part of the Irish convoy, Morholt cleans his blade]

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Morholt, theyre back!  [Cloaked figures ride in while the camp cheers. Suddenly they attack and more British spring from the ground. A battle ensues. Morholt begins to kill the hostages, but Tristan springs to stop him. Sammy is stabbed. Tristan is stabbed by Morholts poisoned blade but manages to kill Morholt. Melot and Tristan run to Sammys side]

Speaker: morholt
Dialogue: Kill the slaves!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Simon!

Speaker: sammy
Dialogue: I dont want to die.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I cant feel my legs or my hands.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Poison.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Build a second boat.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: He shall have a King's service.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Farewell, Tristan of Aragon. Death of the Irish.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: When the Irish came to Cornwall and my father surrendered. You spared a dozen out of a hundred. I am even less kind. The leader and 3 shall take this message home. As for the rest...

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Victory.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Simon too.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Did I love him like a son or did I misuse him for my own purposes?

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: He knew. He knew.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Away.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: You're afflicted child. Speak to me! Your father will find us and have my head. You are my charge. Please!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I am no ones charge!

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: You are. And you will be Morholts Lady!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: And live a loveless life like my mam?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Whats that?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Isolde. Wait! Dont!  Isolde. Dont! Isolde!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Its a man.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Dead?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Alive! Bragnae help me!

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Isolde?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Help me!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Start a fire! Quickly!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: His heart falters.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: He needs heat. Now! Get your clothes off! Quickly!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Hurry! Quickly! Smell that? Smell the poison? When he warms we will need thistle and bark.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Ive not been naked with a man for 15 years!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Hello.  You've been sleeping a long time. You're in Ireland. Did you know that? Shh... It's alright. You're safe here. No one knows. Don't be scared. Just sleep... sleep.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Nooo Nooo Noo!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Its alright, you dont need that! I forgot to tell him about you...

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Ill wait outside with the other beasts.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You said no one else knew.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Sorry... Shes... My maid. Sworn to silence. Um... lie down please. Please?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Its good you are remembering things. This might sting. Do you remember anything else? The boat I found you in? How you got this? Too many questions. Here keep it dry. Here I found bread, you have water and fire. The ocean is outside if you wish a bath. You wont know where you are going so please dont try to leave. Just trust me.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Why are you doing this?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Ill be back

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: This is a dangerous game you are playing. Hes English, Isolde.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Then weve got him prisoner.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Under no circumstances tell him your name, you hear me? Not if you wish him to escape this place. Do you hear me?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Youve been away.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I had noticed. Yes I have a bit.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Bragnae and I were spying the convent of Brittes ].

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Seeking sanctuary?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Some women need it.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Youll find no refuge in a new religion. Your place is here, with Morholt.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Any word of my betrothed?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Overdue. But comforted no doubt that you yearn for him.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Oh, I think it's better if we don't bother with names.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: How can I thank you if I don't have your name?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: You just did. If you insist... my name is Bragnae. I'm a lady in waiting at the court. My parents are dead. My mother, she is the source of the kindness you find so puzzling. My father would've left you where you fell.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Tristan of Aragon.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Well Tristan of Aragon, I'd guess about you too, but I think I've already seen everything.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Sir! I hope you appreciate the risks we are taking, and will honour us by leaving as soon as you are able.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: She likes me. Shes right though, you do risk.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: There. What of your parents?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: They also died when I was a child.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Of what?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: A different type of Irish kindness.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Sorry.  [Bragnae returns and interrupts their moment of tenderness]

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Tomorrow then?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Tomorrow.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: There she who bore you brought you forth.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Ridiculous.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I happen to believe what that says. Dont you think there is more to life?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Than what?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Something more than duty and death! Why are we capable of feelings if not to have them? Why long for things if they are not meant to be ours? Well dont listen to me. Youre so sure of things. Youre certainty, its like armour. I wish I had that.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Why would you need it?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: The joy of being a lady? Wanting something I cant have. A life of my own.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Time for sleep now.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Ill follow you later.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: You need to rest. In case your betrothed should want to see you.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Youre promised?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Whats he like?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Dark. Tall. Nearly twice your size. An absolute gentleman.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I thought... earlier when you spoke of wanting something you cant have.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I didnt know what I was talking about.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Outside, just past that bluff there is a boat. Thats how you should go when you leave. You should go soon.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: How do you feel?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I dont know

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Tristan! Theyve found your boat. At this very moment the King himself is scouring the coast. He will find you. He finds everyone. The tide is coming lets go!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Come with me. Come with me!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I cant

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Why not? Please!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Tristan, weve both known this cant be. Weve known this from the start. That doesnt mean it isnt true. It is. It just cannot be. I want to know that you are alive somewhere thinking of me from time to time. I want to know that there is more to this life and I cant know that if they kill you. Please?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: A Cornish warrior may be ashore. Beware. We seek him as I speak. Hopefully it is just his rotted corpse we'll find, for he has slain your betrothed. Morholt is dead. Fallen in battle. Isolde? Bragnae, comfort her.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Shes stunned.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: As am I by her grief.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: We should assulat the British straight away. Crush them with maximum force.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Maximum force. Like that of Markes tribe with the maximum force you speak of? I will not confront them again until our numbers are refreshed. Until then, well have cunning divide them.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Of what nature?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: A prize, perhaps.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Whats this about a tournament?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Donnchadh. He has offered his daughter and the lands of Lyonesse as dowry to whichever English tribe wins. It is a clever way of setting us against each other.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Well, the other barons will see through that.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: As baron of Wessex it is my duty to fight in this tournament for my people.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: For yourself you mean.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: And what of the support you promised Tristan?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Tristan is dead. My people have suffered enough. They see the wealth of Lyonesse as more real than any alliance. My mind is set.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: And ours as well.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: So be it.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: You're weary, let me rally your friends. Ill lead them against D...

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Ah, Melot, Melot, Melot. You are my blood and you are a noble presence but......

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Lord Marke! Hes back! Its Tristan!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It cannot be!

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: I saw you dead.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I am delivered.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: How? How?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: A toast! Tristan! Back from the dead.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Tristan. The Irish King offers his daughter in tournament to divide the tribes. For the power and the wealth half the tribes have sent champions to fight at the...  Tristan!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: God knows what happened to him.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: "My face in thine eyes, thine in mine appears,

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: It is the only way to keep the alliance alive.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: I fail to see how fighting with our partners keeps us allies.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Well they are all going to the tournament anyway. By announcing you will share the dowry with every Baron that remains loyal and in turn offering to support whomever prevails, the others would be compelled to follow you when you win.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: If we win. If we lose we could end up following Wictred. Id need an infallible champion!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Me.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: You are not yet healed.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Then this trip will be my tonic. I will be ready. I know I will.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: What is the source of this fervour?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Let me go and win you a wife. She can make peace without spilling one drop of blood, and maybe heal a wound from which you still lack.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Truce. You have safe passage.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: How do I look?

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: How do you look?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Where is this Princess? Whats her name? Isolde? I want to see what she looks like.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: There. Almost done.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: No, not quite. If I am to be a present I should be fully wrapped.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: See how the bees come to the honey.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Tristan of Aragon.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: So he lives.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: For the moment.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Wictred of Glastonbury.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: I fight with no champion in my stead. Know that.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Why Wictred?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Because the Barons will never unite behind him.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Do you think shes got the pox?

Speaker: herald
Dialogue: Since the dawn of time...

Speaker: herald
Dialogue: ... Begin!

Speaker: wictreds opponent
Dialogue: Make it for real!

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: wictreds opponent
Dialogue: I yield!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: You were great!

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Allow it!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: It was too easy for you Tristan. Not much for a third draw.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Mace.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: One more fight Tristan. Take deep breaths.

Speaker: herald
Dialogue: Wictred: Lord of Saxonberg. Tristan: Champion of Cornwall. Warriors: Begin!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Yield!

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: An impressive victory. Of course the man who defeats Morholt might be expected to triumph here.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: On behalf of Cornwall, I offer your daughter a place on our throne. The throne of England, united behind one leader.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Isolde! Perhaps it is just that he who took a husband provides one.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Im yours.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: No. Tristan of Aragon has won you on behalf of Lord Marke of Cornwall.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Lets go.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Let them take her across the sea. After the wedding I'll disavow Isolde, the alliance will crumble.

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: Tristan. Princess wants to speak to you.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: You risked your life to give me to another man.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You said your name was Bragnae. Why did you do that?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Oh what have I done? Stop this thing. Say something.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I can't. I won you in my King's name.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: But I am yours. You touched me and I yielded...

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: It doesn't matter.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: It is the only thing that matters Tristan. Leave with me, I will go anywhere.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Your marriage will end a hundred years of bloodshed.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: My marriage to another man!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Isolde. You will live with this. We must.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Don't do this to me.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Tristan, weve made shore.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: What if shes a hag? Or maybe she wont have me!

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: She will brother. Youre the prize.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: My Lord.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Isolde? Welcome.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: If things were different. If we lived in a place without duty... would you be with me?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: That place does not exist.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I'll pretend it's you.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Youre trembling. You are far from home and I am a stranger still. But you mustnt fear me. My wish is to make you happy, as a wife.. as a women and hopefully one day, the fact that I am not whole will not offend you.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Thats pretty. Did you make it?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: It was a present.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Tristan?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Might I stay here a while?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: edyth
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Ive never seen him like this before.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Perhaps someone his own age should speak with him.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: They believe you are distant. They are worried about you. So am I.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I can tell. Laughing at the market, holding hands, a caress on the neck when he pours you wine.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: He is my husband. I remember his Kingdom comes before my life.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Yes well, I must confess I thought you might find more difficulties in performing your duty.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Am I not permitted a single moment without mourning? Living with this Tristan as you said we must.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I live in torture thinking of these moments. With every look he gives you I get sicker and sicker. There is a burning in me, I feel on fire and guilt and I can't get rid of either. Does it make you happy to know that?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: The Roman Bridge. I can get to it without being seen. And I will go there anytime to be there with you.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Welcome bands of Anglia, Rothgar and Orick. Wessex: Kaye and Wictred.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: As you will be King and his daughter Queen, does that mean Donnchadh will be coming to the coronation.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: It does. On the next full moon, all will attend.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: A lot can happen in a month

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Bearing that in mind, and given the instabilities of our new land I shall be naming a second. My sister has raised one, capable of guiding you if the need should arise. He is a man of passion, fierce in battle who has learnt to tame his heart with his head. I give you Tristan of Aragon.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: For the first time since the Romans, this country stands united.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I cant be your second. Melot must be. He is blood. Besides, I wish to journey north.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: You no longer sleep at Dor, and now you dont want to be my second. Do you find no comfort in your home? These stone walls that you helped build?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I find these walls a prison.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Everything I want seems misplaced.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Ever since you were a boy you sacrificed everything for me. All for one dream. Now that you reached that dream, it is natural that you would feel some loss. It doesnt matter if you want to be second. You are. I will only be king if you are my second. Id put it more gently if I could.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Then I am your second.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Perhaps it is time that you took a wife!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Cant live alone forever.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I can!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Isolde. I was trying to explain to Tristan the importance of loving. It seems he might live without it.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: There are other things to live for. Duty. Honour.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: But they are not life Tristan. They are the shells of life. And empty ones and in the end all they hold is days and days without love. Love is made by God. Ignore it and you can suffer as you cannot imagine.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Then I will no longer live without it.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Good. Very good! Come, we will be late!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Late?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: The warriors ride out on the full moon. It is an old ritual. I shall miss you tonight.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: How many did you love before me?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: None.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: And after me?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: None.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Lord Marke! Are you hurt?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Nothing but for my pride.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Tristan, I need to speak with you.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: We havent even had a coronation yet to mark tradition. But now he breaks tradition and scares all the barons by naming you as second.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I tried to convince him you would be better.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Yes well, peace can be just as treacherous as war and I feel that Marke doesnt really...Listen to me!!! Our attention must be on Cornwall now more than ever.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I am sorry he didnt choose you. I am.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Can I speak to you?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: What do you think became of them?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: They were lives... just lived.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I find myself imaging things in this place. I decorate it. Books, a harp there... a child.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Would it be his or mine?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I would have no way to tell, would I? He is a kind man Tristan, I cannot hate him. Yesterday at the market I saw a couple holding hands, and I realised we would never do that. Never anything like it. No picnics or unguarded smiles. No rings. Just stolen moments that leave too quickly.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Where is Isolde?

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: I dont know for sure, she was having a walk in the garden before and Im afraid I got tired so I returned. Its my fault.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Youre going to get caught! Both of you! Hes looking for you right now, hell see you! I told you this would happen!

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: There is another door here, forgotten. This comes up in the bottom chamber of the keep.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I hate this.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Hurry! Go on.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Im tired of this. Im tired of lying for you. Im sick of it.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Then dont.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: There is a servings child, quite ill. Doing better now.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: I didnt ask you were you were. Your heart is beating so fast.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Is it?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Isolde. Is there anything I can do to make you happier. I want to make you happy.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Im fine.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Shes in love with Tristan. Theyre intimates. If I expose them it will break Markes heart and his hold on the other Barons.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: With Markes champion in chains, well take Castle Dor. You can man your armies unopposed. There will be no one defending you in the waters.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: And your price?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: I want Markes throne.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: When his throne falls apart, well go over and pick up the pieces.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan? Can I speak with you? Is it possible... do you think a man blinded by love... Is it possible that that man might not see treachery right in front of him?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Perhaps you could follow her. I cant ask anyone else. I know. I know what you think  Im acting like a child. Normally I can read faces, but with hers I feel like... I can't be objective. Shes so delicate.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You really love her.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Oh... I do...terribly. I didnt know how empty I was. She sustains me, she thrills me. And when I see this ring, it is a ring of thorns.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: The ring is nothing. She's loyal to you. I am sure of it.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: ... If you say so.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I count nine

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: If they move they will warn us with a black flag

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: You bring an entourage?

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: I can let myself be alone in my position Lord Marke. But dont worry, they will stay offshore.  I miss you.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: My nephew, Merlot of Cornwall

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: And Tristan, slayer of my best general, winner of Isolde, defender of the alliance. You are a fortunate man.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Indeed.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan! Seems I worried for nothing.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: May I dance with the Queen, or does Tristan have the next one?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Thats right, you have never danced with Isolde before!

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: A new song for Tristan. Slow.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Why did you burn it?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You know.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Meet me there in an hour or Ill die.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: I could still teach you a thing or two, dancing being one of them.

Speaker: kaye
Dialogue: Accuse him now.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: No, no, no. Well have more than accusations.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Is something the matter?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Im just feeling a little weary thats all. I might just go and have a lie down.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Friends, friends hear me! Weve forgotten the full moon isnt it time to ride out?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: No. Tonight it cause for exception.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: But the coronation should uphold tradition, surely it is not to be neglected already?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: We honour it. In half a night. Ride out! Wheres Tristan?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I miss Ireland

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Isolde, this must end.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Thats like asking me to stop breathing.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: It cannot be.  [Elsewhere Wictred leads the hunt to where Tristan and Isolde are]

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Please dont leave me. Please!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Isolde? There is someone...  No.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: I see how it is in Cornwall. My money is good enough, my alliance is good enough, but my daughter you pass amoung your lieutenants like a whore!

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Its not like that.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: I see no relation to me here! I will see this peace end.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: You have brought the allegiance to shame. Who would fight for this?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Seize him. Seize him.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Behold your hero uncle  I would have no heroes now.

Speaker: bodkin
Dialogue: Theyre ashore.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Prove your worth.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: If a man cant rule his woman, how can he govern an entire Kingdom?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: He cant.

Speaker: lord
Dialogue: We have suffered peace.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Its all been coming apart. I can feel it

Speaker: lord
Dialogue: Youre right.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: There is very little time. Fortunately, Donnchadh has no quarrel with anybody here. Hes asked me to give you a message.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Whats this?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: It is compensation for the men you will lose attacking Castle Dor with Donnchadh tomorrow. Lets be honest, our people need a stronger leader.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: And who might that be, Wictred?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Melot. Too long the ablest amoung us has been denied his rightful place. I pledge you my legiance and offer him my services as his second.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: I like this plan.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: I came to apologise. Ive been selfish arrogantly thinking that perhaps Id given enough. At least enough to merit if not your love then at least your respect. You have a home. A kingdom. Why was it not enough? Tell me.  Tell me! You do not know what you have done! Everything is destroyed, everything! All because you did not have enough. Shes loyal to you I am sure of it. You bloodsucker. What could it had been had I not stretched out my hand to save your life. How I curse that day, how I curse it. And so be with your defence. Then I will go complete your punishment, Donnchadh marches on us as we speak.

Speaker: bragnae
Dialogue: Shes young. I will not let you harm her!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Since you thought he was dead. I found him wounded on the beach in Ireland. I hid him from my father and I told him my name was Bragnae. So when he came to the tournament at Dunluce to win Donnchadhs daughter he didnt realise it was me. All this time my heart has been his, and I am sorry. He tried harder than you can possibly imagine because he loves you.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: I will coax him out, make sure Donnchadh knows this.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Of course, of course. You know as things moved along I suspected them for some time.

Speaker: merlot
Dialogue: Tristan and Isolde?

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: You know what I could never work out? How it was conducted. How she got in and out of Dor unseen.

Speaker: merlot
Dialogue: The tunnel.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: merlot
Dialogue: The Roman Tunnel!

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Show me.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: The will of the King. Farwell.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: I told him about Ireland. Hes given us our freedom. Why does loving you feel so wrong?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Get in.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Tristan, if I do this.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: For all time, they will say it was our love that brought down a kingdom. Remember us.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Tristan, dont! Tristan! Tristan! Tristan! Why?! Tristan!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Get the livestock and fuel undercover. Put some archers on the ramparts.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: All the archers have deserted us as has half the household.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: And you stay?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: If you are surprised then they have won already.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Come on, hurry!

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Burn it. Their will is as strong as milk. The seas will unravel us. Where is Wictred with his key?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: It comes up to the Roman foundations at the lowest level.

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: This is a godsend!  [They both enter it and Wictred gestures for his men to follow]

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: What will you say to him?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: That he will not make any more mistakes and that it is time for him to move ba  whats that?!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Aim for the front of the line

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: They are waiting.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: The Irish are inside!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Follow me!

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Bar the door make sure no one gets in!

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: What happened here?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: A reward for idiocy. A dozen Irish have blazed your way.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Melot, I came to aid Marke.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Everyone lies.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: I didnt lead them here.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: No, I did.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: I thought someone believed in me.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: It will be undone.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: TristanIm for the wormsswear to me that you are true.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: As we were brothers.

Speaker: melot
Dialogue: Build my boat.

Speaker: wictreds man
Dialogue: Theyre here!

Speaker: wictred
Dialogue: Keep them back.

Speaker: markes man
Dialogue: Wictred.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Hes trying to lower the bridge

Speaker: markes man
Dialogue: Traitor!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Give me your shield, were pinned down!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan!

Speaker: markes man
Dialogue: Him too?

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: No, hes with us!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan!  [Tristan stabs Wictred and kills him. Tristan pulls the sword from his body as the battle subsides]

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Tristan! How did you get here?

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Secret. Secrets, in the bowls of the keep.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: In the bowls of the keep.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: They have reached the palisades.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Then we must keep hope.

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Get back! Ha ha ha! Ha ha ha!  [Tristan slowly steps out with the head of Wictred in his hands]

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Behold! The head of a traitor!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Will you always be little men, who cannot see what was and could be again? There is no middle ground! So slay us  or slay him!

Speaker: king donnchadh
Dialogue: Oblidge them.  Oblidge them!  [He attacks people around him, but is shot in the back by an arrow. Suddenly the Irish and the British start to fight. Tristan falls to the ground and Marke runs to his side]

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: Take me out of here. Take me to the river.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Hurry!

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: Bring her.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Marke, you must come, the battle needs you. Well lose everything.

Speaker: marke
Dialogue: I must heed their call, I am the King.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Weve driven them back as far as we can but they are holding us at the throat.

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Goodbye my friend.  [Marke and his generals leave and Isolde goes to Tristans side]

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: Know that I love you Tristan. And wherever you go, whatever you see, I will always be with you.

Speaker: tristan
Dialogue: You were right. I do not know if life is greater than death, but love was more than either.

Speaker: isolde
Dialogue: "My face in thine eyes, thine in mine appears,
